details.title: Optimum relative speed discretisation for detection of moving objects in wide band SAR

authors.affiliation: Dept. of Signal Process., Blekinge Inst. of Technol., Ronneby
authors.name: M.I. Pettersson

details.abstract: Here, ground moving target indication (GMTI) using synthetic aperture radar (SAR) is considered. SAR GMTI requires that relative speed between the target and the SAR platform is included in the detection algorithm. A separation between the true relative speed and the relative speed used in the SAR process will cause unfocused targets, and decrease detectability. Blind hypotheses of relative speeds are used in the detection phase of moving targets in SAR. The step size between the hypotheses (or discretisation step) in relative speed involves a trade off between the number of hypotheses to test and detectability. A large number of tests will increase detectability but will also increase computation load and vice versa. The relevance of relative speed increases as the azimuth integration time gets larger. Long integration time is associated with low signature moving target detection in strong clutter environments, or for SAR GMTI at low frequencies. The optimum discretisation of normalised relative speed for moving target detection has been determined. The optimum discretisation is derived from the moving target impulse response. Use of optimum discretisation reduces the computation burden in SAR GMTI and secures the detectability.

ieee.title: Detection of Moving Targets by Focusing in UWB SAR—Theory and Experimental Results
ieee.displayText: Viet Thuy Vu, Thomas K. Sjogren, Mats I. Pettersson, Anders Gustavsson, Lars M. H. Ulander, "Detection of Moving Targets by Focusing in UWB SAR—Theory and Experimental Results", Geoscience and Remote Sensing IEEE Transactions on, vol. 48, pp. 3799-3815, 2010, ISSN 0196-2892.

ieee.title: Local detection of moving target by focusing in SAR images
ieee.displayText: Viet Vu, Mats Pettersson, Thomas Sjögren, "Local detection of moving target by focusing in SAR images", Radar Conference (RadarConf) 2016 IEEE, pp. 1-6, 2016, ISSN 2375-5318.

ieee.title: Application of the moving target detection by focusing technique in civil traffic monitoring
ieee.displayText: V. T. Vu, T. K. Sjögren, M. I. Pettersson, P. A. C. Marques, "Application of the moving target detection by focusing technique in civil traffic monitoring", Geoscience and Remote Sensing Symposium (IGARSS) 2010 IEEE International, pp. 4118-4121, 2010, ISSN 2153-7003.

ieee.title: Moving Target Detection by Forcusing for Frequency Domain Algorithms in UWB Low Frequency SAR
ieee.displayText: Viet T. Vu, Thomas K. Sjogren, Mats I. Pettersson, "Moving Target Detection by Forcusing for Frequency Domain Algorithms in UWB Low Frequency SAR", Geoscience and Remote Sensing Symposium 2008. IGARSS 2008. IEEE International, vol. 1, pp. I-161-I-164, 2008.

ieee.title: Moving Target Relative Speed Estimation and Refocusing in Synthetic Aperture Radar Images
ieee.displayText: Thomas K. Sjogren, Viet T. Vu, Mats I. Pettersson, Anders Gustavsson, Lars M. H. Ulander, "Moving Target Relative Speed Estimation and Refocusing in Synthetic Aperture Radar Images", Aerospace and Electronic Systems IEEE Transactions on, vol. 48, pp. 2426-2436, 2012, ISSN 0018-9251.

ieee.title: Performance of moving target parameter estimation using SAR
ieee.displayText: Mats I. Pettersson, Thomas K. Sjogren, Viet T. Vu, "Performance of moving target parameter estimation using SAR", Aerospace and Electronic Systems IEEE Transactions on, vol. 51, pp. 1191-1202, 2015, ISSN 0018-9251.

ieee.title: Fast Detection of Moving Targets by Focusing in UWB low frequency SAR
ieee.displayText: Viet T. Vu, Thomas K. Sjogren, Mats I. Pettersson, "Fast Detection of Moving Targets by Focusing in UWB low frequency SAR", Radar Conference 2009 IEEE, pp. 1-5, 2009, ISSN 1097-5659.

ieee.title: Efficient Motion Compensation of a Moving Object on SAR Imagery Based on Velocity Correlation Function
ieee.displayText: Motofumi Arii, "Efficient Motion Compensation of a Moving Object on SAR Imagery Based on Velocity Correlation Function", Geoscience and Remote Sensing IEEE Transactions on, vol. 52, pp. 936-946, 2014, ISSN 0196-2892.

ieee.title: Moving-Target Tracking in Single-Channel Wide-Beam SAR
ieee.displayText: Daniel Henke, Christophe Magnard, Max Frioud, David Small, Erich Meier, Michael E. Schaepman, "Moving-Target Tracking in Single-Channel Wide-Beam SAR", Geoscience and Remote Sensing IEEE Transactions on, vol. 50, pp. 4735-4747, 2012, ISSN 0196-2892.
